alert.note: Alert for Custer; Fall River (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 1:55PM MDT until further notice by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest South Dakota, including the following counties, Custer and Fall River. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 155 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Moss Agate Creek, Driftwood Creek, Pleasant Valley Creek, Hot Brook, Cottonwood Springs Creek, Dry Creek, West Fork Hawkwright Creek, West Pass Creek, Hawkwright Creek, Beaver Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Pass Creek, East Fork Hawkwright Creek, Coon Creek and Carroll Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Argyle and Burdock.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
